title: FAA Administrator Steve Dickson Expected to Resign: Sources; Mr. Dickson Has Overseen 5G Air Safety Debate
text:
Mr. Dickson was appointed to a five-year term by then-President Trump in 2019. He took over the agency after two Boeing Co. 737 MAX jets crashed, and the FAA was facing criticism from U.S. lawmakers for its oversight of the aircraft's development.

The FAA didn't immediately respond to requests for comment late Wednesday. A spokeswoman for the Department of Transportation, which oversees the agency, declined to comment.

This developing story will be updated.

Write to Andrew Tangel at Andrew.Tangel@wsj.com and Catherine Lucey at catherine.lucey@wsj.com

FAA Administrator Steve Dickson Expected to Resign: Sources
